content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(replace(lowercase(col), " " => "_"), "-" => "_")
end
```
This function works by converting the input string to lower case, replacing spaces with underscores and hyphens also with underscore. The `replace` function is used for this purpose. It takes two arguments, a string to replace and a string or a character array (in which each element represents a possible substring of the original string) that needs to be replaced by another string. 

For example, calling `clean_column("My Column")` will return `"my_column"`.
